data.title: Who's seeing Artie Lange's Beer League this weekend? (Theater list)
data.meta_description: It's starting up opening in over 160 theaters out of the greater NYC, Philly, and Cleveland areas (where Stern nation is strongest apparently). They're then...
data.text:
It's starting up opening in over 160 theaters out of the greater NYC, Philly, and Cleveland areas (where Stern nation is strongest apparently). They're then planning on getting a nationwide release weeks later to over 2100 theaters.

Here's where it'll be on Friday:

Tower City 11 Cleveland, OH

Shuley said:

This movie looks stupid.Probably will be one of the worst films of the year...right up there with Nacho Libre

you said that the one film everyone should watch is that so-called film You Me And You And Everyone We Know. Your bankruptcy of taste is astonishingly clear when you don't atleast think about murdering the dingbat who made that cinematic abortion after sitting through it.

It represents everything wrong with modern independant cinema, it was the Garden State of 2005.

I don't know what Beer League has to do with Nacho Libre, other than a fat guy as a lead. Nacho Libre has much more in common with dretch like You Me And You And Everyone We Know, as both represent the common phenomenon of industry know-nothings rewarding the quirkiness-as-a-substition-for-actual-creativity film model.

Bankruptcy of taste? I'm not the one who is telling people to go see this lame ass piece of garbage,most unfunny comedy...Beer League is sheer stupidity at it's finest...Beer League and Nacho Libre have two things in common...they both suck. Me and You and Everyone We Know was excellent,unlike Beer League.

Me And You And Everyone We Know - Critics' Reviews

http://movies.yahoo.com/movie/1808624393/critic

Nuff' Said
